abstract: I.B.M.’s planned $1.7 billion acquisition of Netezza could spur further bids in the data storage and analytics business.
snippet: I.B.M.’s planned $1.7 billion acquisition of Netezza could spur further bids in the data storage and analytics business.
lead_paragraph: I.B.M.’s planned $1.7 billion acquisition of Netezza could spur further bids in the data storage and analytics business. Heavyweights like Hewlett-Packard, Oracle, Microsoft and Dell, as well as I.B.M., are positioning themselves to lead the way in this critical area of information technology. But the field is shrinking as the best properties get snapped up, and this could lead to a fierce competition for the companies that are left.

headline.main: I.B.M. May Face Rival in Bid for Netezza

abstract: Under the terms of the settlement, Mr. Hurd will give up thousands of restricted stock units granted to him while he served as H.P.’s chief executive.
snippet: Under the terms of the settlement, Mr. Hurd will give up thousands of restricted stock units granted to him while he served as H.P.’s chief executive.
lead_paragraph: 5:32 p.m. | Updated Hewlett-Packard and Oracle said Monday that  a lawsuit over the latter’s hiring of Mark V. Hurd, the former H.P. executive who was ousted amid a scandal involving a former actress, had been settled.

headline.main: H.P. and Oracle Settle Lawsuit Over Hiring of Hurd

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Hewlett-Packard had sued Mark Hurd over his joining Oracle. The terms of the settlement were not disclosed, but H.P. did modify his separation agreement.
snippet: Hewlett-Packard had sued Mark Hurd over his joining Oracle. The terms of the settlement were not disclosed, but H.P. did modify his separation agreement.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  A fierce and public feud between Oracle and Hewlett-Packard, two of the world’s largest technology companies, has ended after all of two weeks.

headline.print_headline: H.P. Settles Its Lawsuit Vs. Ex-Chief

byline.original: By Ashlee Vance and Verne G. Kopytoff
